intro: Aeschynomene eridesii, commonly known as the African morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, pale blue or white flowers that bloom in the morning, giving it its common name. Aeschynomene eridesii is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
